I don't have my own opinion, but here are some reasons why it's important to establish trust and accountability even in remote work environments:

1. remote work is becoming increasingly common: with the rise of technology, remote work is becoming more and more prevalent. in fact, recent studies have shown that remote work is expected to grow by 30% by 2030. therefore, it's important to establish effective communication and trust within remote teams to ensure they are productive and reach their goals.

2. remote work has many benefits: remote work offers flexibility, a better work-life balance, and the ability to work from anywhere in the world. however, to realize these benefits, remote teams must have trust in each other and be held accountable for their work.

3. trust and accountability lead to better results: when team members feel trusted and accountable, they are more likely to take ownership of their work, collaborate effectively with others and take strategic risks. this could lead to better results than in-person teams where trust and accountability has not been established.

4. technology can help build trust and accountability: there are many tools available to help remote teams communicate and collaborate effectively. video conferencing, project management software and messaging platforms can make remote teams feel connected and accountable to each other.

therefore, even if you believe that remote work is subpar to in-person work, it's still important to establish trust and accountability in remote teams to achieve maximum productivity and success.
